description: An explanation on data required for regular client requests for step 1 of the wizard.
content: Enter the number of undergraduate and/or graduate students.  We use this to determine the number of user ids.  We will give you a few extra as well.

description: Help for step 2 of the wizard
content: Click the products on the left list to add them to your request. You can remove them from your request by clicking the products on the right list.  You can select up to REQUEST_LIMIT products.

description: Help for step 3 of the wizard.
content: Enter any additional instructions that will help us fulfill your request.

description: Help for step 4 of the wizard
content:
Enter the dates you will require each product. If you don't need every product at the beginning of the term, choose a date a week before you will need it. Keep in mind that it helps us to balance our load if requests are spread out.

Review your information and click Complete to save your request

You have an existing request created on DATECREATED

You can add products, change start and ending dates or edit the comment.  However you cannot change a product that has already been assigned.
You can add students, change dates or enter comments on this page.  If you wnat to add products, use the wizard on the Create Request page.

Faculty Development Clients

These clients are useful if you want to practice and will not use the client in a class. If you will be using this client in a class this session, choose a regular client. The clients are issued from a shared system used specifically for development clients. The advantage is that they do not count against the client quota specified in your EUA.

By default you will receive two user ids. If you need more, you enter a comment on step 3 of the wizard.

1. Select the product request from the table below.  If the table doesn't appear, you have no active client requests.

  2. Fill inthe information about the curriculum. Complete as many fields as possible.

  3. Enter a description of the problem. Be as specific as possible and inlcude the steps that led up to the issue.

  4. Attach files that include any relevant information such as screenshots of error messages.  To attach files, click the Browse button.

Select the product and enter the user ids of the passwords you need reset.

If the user ids are on a ERP system, you can reset passwords and unlock user accounts in transaction SU01.
Select the product and describe the problem as thouroughly as possible.
Select the ERPSim client to refresh.

This includes applications other than those hosted at the UCC.  Select the product from the drop down list and provide as much information about the error as possible.

If possible upload screen shots that show the problem.

description: Shown when user selects a help ticket category that requires product requests
content: This category requires that you have active product requests and you currently have NUMBER requests.
Enter the dates when you will need the clients.  Accurate dates help us to better utilize our resources.

description: Appears above the editor on the create help ticket screen.
content: Enter a description of the issue. Be as specific as possible and include steps that led up to the issue.

Upload screenshots or other files that will help us solve you problem


If you want to upload multiple files, hold the control key while selecting files
Select the product request and enter a description of the problem.
To create product request, start by selecting the session.
description: Shown at the beginning of the client request wizard.
Appears when a session is selected
content:
What type of request do you want:  

  • You can request a trial client for yourself.   You will only receive 2 user ids and will be in a client shared by other faculty.

  • A regular class is used in a class.

description: An explanation of regular client requests
content: These clients are to use in a course so you must choose the course.  You can use the plus icon <i class="fa fa-plus" aria-hidden="true"></i> to create a new class or the pencil icon <i class="fa fa-pencil" aria-hidden="true"></i> to edit an existing course. Next, provide the number of students, both undergraduate and graduate and select the start and end dates of your semester. Note that the start and end dates must fall with the dates of the session you have chosen.

description: Shown after the user has selected a category
content: To further clarify the purpose of the help ticket, select the type in the drop down list above.
Enter a description of the problem.  Include as much detail as possible and attach screenshots or other documents that will be helpful in resolving your problem.

description: Message that explains entering the steps to recreate the problem
content: Enter the steps required to recreate the problem.  Try to make it complete enough that we can create the exact same circumstances.
